Message.Title: Yahoo to Rise 12% in 49 Days? Some Options Traders Think So
Message.Msg: Yesterday we saw someone buy the November 17/18 call spread for a net debit of $0.12. This is a bullish spread that returns $0.88 if Yahoo is above 18 at expiration, and only loses $0.12 if YHOO is below 17 at expiration. With YHOO closing yesterday at 16.04, this option trader is expecting the stock to appreciate 12% over the next 49 days. There are several possible reasons for this bullishness. First, Forbes reported that Eric Schmidt of Google said he is interested in a search deal with Yahoo. In addition, Yahoo has recently replaced its CEO and CFO in order to revitalize the company. And finally, Goldman Sachs has reinstated coverage of YHOO with a buy rating and price target of $22.

Topic.Title: Yahoo reinstated as a buy by Goldman Sachs - Target $22

Message.Msg: Monday and $3.6 billion for shareholders.

Topic.Title: Marissa not popular with stock holder

Message.Msg: I doubt Marissa understands the intricacies of Yahoo nearly well enough to already be telling employees their projects must generate at least $100,000,000 sales revenue to the company, or else its not acceptable. Is that how business was done at Google?? I expect not. What this is saying is Marissa does not have any concretely designed business plan to bring to the CEO's post so her days as head of Yahoo are numbered. Expect her time will probably end up being a "conduit" through which Yahoo will somehow ally its search engine with Google or Microsoft. I still think that Yahoo was foolish not to go in with Microsoft last year. Boy if Marissa has any brains in that beautiful blond head of hers she will see Google buys Yahoo out and she can probably retire for life with a big golden chute retirement package. Right now Yahoo is really not got much of a future; it's demise is written on the walls. Marissa can't save a sinking ship called Yahoo. Hell, they have fired 3 CEO's in less than 6 months. That ought to tell Marissa, Yahoo investors, company employees it is time to be scared shitless. I hope all involved will start to show some intellectual honesty in their assessment of what it will take to salvage of what is left of Yahoo. In this matter, Marissa might consult with John Chambers at Cisco whose company has recently started to make a comeback, but whose CEO has been around since that company was started well over 20 years ago. That is something I would say is of financially redeeming value that Yahoo must attempt to cultivate in making itself both a profitable enterprise and an attractive investment opportunity.

Topic.Title: Marissa not popular with stock holder
